RautSoft.math.lp
Class Simplex

java.lang.Object
  RautSoft.math.lp.Simplex

public class Simplex
extends java.lang.Object

Solves LP problem using Simplex algorithm. The code is adopted from Numerical Recipe. 

 
                 max c'x
                 subject to
                 Ax <= b (b >=0) m1 such constriants
                 Ax >= b (b >=0) m2 such constriants
                 Ax = b (b >=0) m3 such constriants
                 all x's >=0

Usage:

  
        double [][] A =  { {-1.0, 0.0, -2.0, 0.0},{0.0, -2.0, 0.0, 7.0}, {0.0, -1.0, 1.0, -2.0}, { -1.0, -1.0, -1.0, -1.0}};
        int n=4,m1=2,m2=1,m3=1;
        double [] b = {740, 0,.5,9.0};
        double [] c = {1, 1,3,-.5};
        Simplex lp = new Simplex(A,b,c,n,m1,m2,m3);
        lp.Compute();
        System.out.println("Output of the LP" + lp);
        System.out.println("Output of the LP" + lp.getLogs());
        System.out.println("Output of the LP" + lp.getOutput());
        double[][] a=lp.getFinalTableu(); //gets the final tableau
        System.out.println("The matrix A after simplex");
        System.out.println("The max obj = " + lp.getOptimizedObjective() );
        double [] xopt=lp.getOptimalPrimalSolution()) ) ;
For a standard maximization problem with m2=m3=0, the constructor is overloaded to be invoked as follows 
 Simplex lp = new Simplex(A,b,c); instead of Simplex lp = new Simplex(A,b,c,n,m1,m2,m3);

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Lakshmi K. Raut
